question.title: Interface without Jakarta Validation annotation for validation in implementation class
question.body:
I want to create a REST API in which I use Jakarta Validation constraint annotations such as @NotNull, @Valid, @Max...

But I want to define the methods for the controller in an interface as follows:

public interface IMyController<T> {
    Response post(T obj);
}

public class MyController implements IMyController<MyObject> {
    @Override
    public Response post(@NotNull @Valid MyObject obj){...}
}

Due to Jakarta Validation, the parameter definition in the interface does not allow validation in implementation classes if the interface does not contain any validation annotations.

Error message:

Servlet Request processing failed: jakarta.validation.ConstraintDeclarationException: HV000151: A method overriding another method must not redefine the parameter constraint configuration, but method MyController#post(MyObject) redefines the configuration of IMyController#post(Object).

Is there a way to fix this? I mean, there is @Validated (org.springframework.validation.annotation.Validated), for example, but that's a bit cumbersome because I have to define a new interface for all validation annotations and add it to all methods with @Validated.

I considered using another annotation, if there is one, or writing my own annotation, but that would be my first annotation implementation, so I don't know how to do it.

Can you tell me if there is already an annotation for this or how I can create my own annotation?

question_comments.body: @Slaw Yes. Is there a sceond option or how complicated is it to write an own annotation to allow different validations from the interface? For example @AllowLazyValidation on the Interface or the Class to do this.

So to clarify, you want the second option? Where you have multiple implementations of IMyController, and each implementation is capable of having its own, different set of validation annotations for the parameter of post?

@BasilBourque SpringBoot should not play a role here, as this concerns Jakarta Validation, regardless of whether I would use SpringBoot or Quarkus. I have never used Jakarta in any other context before, but I suspect that the error also occurs in general when implementing interfaces if you do not insert annotations into the methods of the interface, but only do so in the implementation class.
@Slaw this is exactly the problem I want to fix, because the error message is default by my try to implement it like that. So i search for an alternative to use my code.
@BasilBourque Is that the same thing? I would assume jakarta.validation.constraints.NotNull and org.jspecify.annotations.NonNull serve different purposes.
FYI, Spring is being revamped to adopt JSpecify for null safety and analysis. See their blog post of 2025-03.

From the error message, it sounds like you need to put the @NotNull and @Valid on the method's parameter in the interface: Response post(@NotNull @Valid T obj);. Then all implementations of IMyController would have those validations for post. Is that what you want? Or are you trying to have different validations for different implementations?
